events.event_description: LPG and ethane exports through the Panama Canal increased in January 2024 as drought conditions eased, with LPG transit volumes rising 12% and ethane volumes up 67% compared to December 2023.
events.citation: Transit slots that opened up in January allowed more VLGC voyages through the Panama Canal, increasing January 2024 LPG transit volumes by 12% and ethane transit volumes by 67% compared with December 2023.

events.event_description: Water levels at Gatun Lake reached their lowest levels since recordkeeping began in 1965, leading to reduced traffic and longer delays at the Panama Canal.
events.citation: In 2023, water levels at Gatun Lake, which supplies the water used to operate the canal's locks, were the lowest since at least 1965, when recordkeeping began.

events.event_description: VLGC shipping rates from the U.S. Gulf Coast to Chiba, Japan reached a record high of $250 per metric ton.
events.citation: VLGC rates on this route reached $250 per metric ton for the week ending September 29, the highest since rates were first published in 2016.

events.event_description: Houthi rebel attacks in the Red Sea caused decreased transit volumes through the Bab el-Mandeb Strait and increased shipments around the Cape of Good Hope.
events.citation: In mid-November, attacks on vessels by Yemen-based Houthi rebels decreased transit volumes through the Bab el-Mandeb in December and increased transit volumes around the Cape of Good Hope.

events.event_description: U.S. propane exports reached record levels, averaging over 1.7 million barrels per day.
events.citation: Weekly U.S. propane exports have also been the highest ever, averaging well over 1.7 million b/d from November 2023 to February 2024.
